page.title: 14RAMSGATE POLICE
page.content: The local police force has over 100 personnel and covers the Ramsgate area Sandwich and rural area.The station is over 100 years old and has 7 cells.The most common local crimes are petty theft and shoplifting but nearly half of the crimes are solved.Busiest times are Friday and Saturday nights because of disorderly behaviour after pubs close.We told Chief Inspector Wall what our parents survey had found-that they were worried about the increase in anti social behaviour,aggression & violence of youngsters.Children as young as 7 are involved in crime.One of the main causes is lack of discipline at home. Crime is increasing everywhere and the policeman's job is becoming more difficult. The public attitude of "I don't want to get involved" is very unhelpful to the police and allows criminals to escape conviction.
